Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean rooms, perfect 2 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: mturan
Reviews.Content: Staff is very friendly. Hotel location is good. Pretty close to Eiffel tower. If I go Paros and look for a reasonable priced hotel this would be the place to go. Though the bathroom is clean and modern there is no minibar at the room.

Reviews.Title: “It made our stay in Paris memorable...”
Reviews.Author: MeriamTanGravador
Reviews.Content: I am writing my first review in TripAdvisor and what a nice way to start this by giving a merci beaucoup to Hotel de l'Avre. Right after we landed at Orly Sud Aeroport my husband booked as a ticket for an AirFrance Bus so we could travel comfortably as i am 5-mos pregnant. I was a little bit worried since this is our first time in Paris and we are not familiar with the place so I just depended on my husband on how to get to the hotel from the airport as he was the one who booked this hotel based on the great reviews that was written and sure it didn't disappoint us after going to the Metro and rode Line 6 we passed by 6 stops and arrived at La Motte Piquet Grenelle and after a 3mins walked we are already at the Hotel so this was really a bonus as I am not going to like if we are to walk a long way to get the hotel esp as we came on a winter season and Voila! The receptionist was very nice and professional in greeting us we proceed directly to our room and we were happy to see that our room has everything we need a nice bed, a shower, cable and most importantly a wifi connection free of charge and also fast! To make the story short I am very impressed with the way they manage this hotel it is situated in a nice place, safe, quiet, convenient, lots of cafe, convenience store and just very near 3 metro stations that will reach you to famous tourist spot but the best thing is we were able to find a very nice asian restaurant nearby which i needed to eat familiar food for me and my baby. All in all the owners and staff are very accomodating and the room is always organized and clean. Next time we will be visiting Paris this is our hotel of choice for obvious reasons and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “A haven in central Paris”
Reviews.Author: DarcyZam
Reviews.Content: This is our first time in Paris and the only guide i have is the advanced research i did on the internet on how to go to this location and so right after landing at Orly Sud Aeroport viola! everything went according to plan. We arrived and board thru the AirFrance bus Line 1 and we stop at Etoille afterwards we went to the Metro for Line 6 very near the AirFrance Bus stop and after 6 stations we arrived at La Motte Piquet station and we walked to the hotel which is very near to this stop. Everything is very convenient considering that my wife is 5mos pregnant then the location is fantastic lots of cafe, convenience store, very well lighted, safe and most importantly since we are used to Asian Food there is a place quite near that served asian cuisines. this place really made our first trip to Paris very memorable! PS the owners are very accomodating and friendly. everything is very organized and clean. Next time we'll visit Paris we will be looking forward to coming over here again. Merci Hotel de l'avre!

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: penninematt
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for a long weekend for myself and my wife based on the many good reviews on trip advisor. It didn't disappoint. From the first moment we arrived, until we checked out, the staff were always friendly at attentive. It is in a great location, away from the crowds. Yet it is easy to access all of the tourist spots due to the metro station being just a couple of minutes away. The rooms are small, but nothing unusual for Parisian standards. They are clean, and very nicely decorated. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was fine. I would certainly stay here again, and would recommend it to friends who were planning a trip to Paris

Reviews.Title: “My Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: LaMaisonGrise
Reviews.Content: I’ve stayed in half a dozen different hotels in Paris and this is my keeper. I love the location: a busy vibrant neighborhood with good café’s, one of the nicer Monoprixes on the corner, three metro lines crossing to give fast city access, great markets twice a week and very, few tourists. The Avre’s rooms are small – typical of less expensive Parisian hotels – but nicely decorated, i.e. none of that horrendous 1950ish wallpaper that infects many lower end hotels. The breakfast room opens onto an pleasant interior garden where you can breakfast in temperate weather. Interior rooms, recommended, open on to this garden, not an airshaft. Staff varies from professional to friendly. Recommended local cafés: Le Bouquet de Grenelle and Le Suffren on Le Motte-Picquet. After dinner walk up to the Eiffel Tower to watch the lights come on. Congratulate yourself. You didn’t take a cruise or go to a theme park. You went to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stuff!”
Reviews.Author: StraightTripin
Reviews.Content: Great location. Clean. Affordable for Paris. Nice enough staff. Awkward toilet. Straight up shabby chic!

Reviews.Title: “A treasure in Paris”
Reviews.Author: EvidencebyFran
Reviews.Content: This hotel was such a great find. It is less than a kilometre walk to the Eiffel Tower and the metro station is at the end of the street. The hotel is surrounded by patisseries, shops and restaurants but it is very quiet at night. The room was small but it suited our needs as we didn't spend much time there! The staff are exceptionally friendly and helpful, they let us reserve our flights online and print our tickets. The security is good, you have to buzz in and the staff will open the door for you and your key is kept at reception so you don't have to worry about losing it. There is a small lift for those who don't want to take the stairs! Breakfast was a little expensive, but you don't need it as there are plenty of other options on the street just outside. I think I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel de l'Avre is a cute nice Parisian hotel. It made my first visit in Paris perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Veve547
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 7 days (after Xmas to new year 2012). Place was chosen based on recommendation of a travel guide. It was a good decision; it's well located (near to metro station Le Motte Picquet Grenelle), many brasseries & convenient stores around the place, clean room (we stayed at 1st floor facing the street with a window), staff is helpful & some speaks English. I landed in Paris at 5.30am & arrived at the hotel before 7am. We forgot to ask for early check in, however after waiting for awhile, the staff was happy enough to provide a temporary room for us to shower & change clothes. ps.: the small cute garden at the backyard makes this hotel really European style. Nice for breakfast place in shiny days. Hotel experience really makes "my first trip to Paris" perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortably Chic!”
Reviews.Author: jesstagirl
Reviews.Content: Hotel de l'Avre is in a great location—steps away from a metro and the Eiffel Tower. We arrived into Orly and I wasn't sure how to get to the hotel. I emailed them and received a very prompt reply with great directions. Our room (number 32) was cute, chic, and very comfortable! For the price, it was fantastic and I was shocked at how large our room was—something you don't see often in Paris. We didn't have their breakfast (went to one of the many cafes around the hotel), but I'm glad they offered it. The hotel has an elevator (a definite plus) and hotel staff is on duty 24/7, although fair warning: the night shift doesn't always speak English! We will definitely stay there again on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money!”
Reviews.Author: Dunebuggy12345
Reviews.Content: Just rehashing what's already been said. Location is one block away from a major metro subway stop. About 10-15 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower (great if you like walking after dinner). Safe neighborhood but away from the tourist zones. Rooms and washrooms are small but go in with that expectation. Great value for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Darling little hotel”
Reviews.Author: babsie321
Reviews.Content: Absolutely charming little hotel. Darling rooms, well equipped and comfortable. Quiet yet central location. Friendly, helpful staff and delicious breakfast. Excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: nashari
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a week in September. Very nice, clean hotel with a charm. Rooms are small but nicely decorated (2*+ or even 3*). The hotel is located in a quiet street, 2 minutes walk from Motte Piquet Grenelle Metro station (line 10, 8 and 8) and only 15 min walk to the Eiffel tower. There are a lot of nice restaurants and cafes by the metro so no need to take breakfast at the hotel. Highly recommended for a relatively budget (89 euro for dbl with shower) but still very comfortable stay in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION GREAT AREA, good size room, good staff”
Reviews.Author: saz1241
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with a friend for 4 nights. We had a twin room with a bathroom. The hotel is literally 1 minutes walk from La Motte-Piquet Grenelle metro station (3 lines pass through it)!! The area is fab and a walk to the Eiffel Tower takes about 5-10 minutes I would always recommend staying in this area of Paris as it's a great price with great connections to rest of city. The hotel was good, clean and very easy to find - my only problems were that the shower cubicle was a bit of a tight fit to get into (I think double rooms might have baths as well as showers?) The twin room had a view of the street (as opposed to the double which mainly have view of the hotels pretty courtyard) but I did not mind as I liked watching the goings on of the street. The street the hotel was on is very quiet as it is just off the main road. The rooms were nicely decorated with French style and had enough space to easily walk around beds/desk - only real problem with the bedroom area was the lack of safe to lock things in, and also when having a lay in on a couple of occasions the cleaners walked in (even though I had double locked the door and left the key in) which was a bit awkward and surprising - but we had no problem with them, we communicated in my broken French and they left us to it! Other than that the staff were super helpful and we were able to leave luggage in a locked room after check out. Any questions please don't hesitate to contact me! :)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with minor flaws”
Reviews.Author: dk_worldwide
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this lovely place for two nights. My single room was on the fourth floor facing the rather quiet street. Everything was very clean and both the room and bathroom were big enough for me. The bed was lovely, free WiFi available and the little garden is the perfect place to relax after a long day. Staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful at all times. With a direct connection to the Paris Metro system I was able to go wherever I wanted in the blink of an eye. As I was attending a congress at Porte de Versailles Convention Centre I was amazed about the bus no. 80 running straight from the hotel to the congress centre in less than 10 minutes. Lots of cafés and restaurants are close by and if you want to equip yourself for a picknick in the beautiful Champs de Mars (a leisurely 10-minute walk) you can pick up food on the first floor of the Monoprix branch right around the corner of the hotel. The bedside lamp and one electrical socket were not working and I kindly asked staff to take care of this but nothing happened. As I was checking out after two nights I did not care too much but I hope that this issue was solved for the next guest. Verdict: Great little hotel to stay if you want to avoid the large chains and are more into "true Parisian places".

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Cosy, and in a Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Slersh
Reviews.Content: I stayed both in a twin room (for the first night with a friend) and in a single room for subsequent nights when I was exploring Paris alone. The twin room was clean, and cosy, though a little on the small/ narrow side. No complains about that though, as the hotel makes very good use of the compact space. There is a small desk / chair by the window and a flat panel TV. The bathroom is nicely and naturally lit by the light coming from its tall windows which are fitted with wooden blinds. It is again on the compact side, but spacious and comfortable enough for the hotel to also fit a hairdryer in, as well as a movable shelf for you to put your stuff on. The single room was nice, basic and mostly clean except that I found a dead fly by the curtains and somebody's leftover tank top in the wardrobe. Hence, the cleaning process was not really thorough. I had good nights of sleep here as the ambience of the room is really cosy for one. Other than the cosy and clean rooms, the hotel is at a fantastic location: very near the metro (<5mins walk), and has a lift (thank god!). Staff are helpful and speaks good English. There's also a supermarket (Monoprix), McDonald's, a good selection of restaurants (including Chinese food, Sushi / Jap food, Pizza Hut) and cafes, as well as a shopping strip consisting of brands such as H&M, Zara and GAP just on the next street / around the corner. Free wifi is also available for all rooms though the quality of connection varies - sometimes there aren't any network found at all. The staff mentioned that they are working on improving this and hence, the free wifi issue should be resolved in no time. Overall, I love this hotel for its cosiness, convenience (the lift is a gods end, really!) and its fantastic location. It is very easy to eat, shop, get around from this hotel's location which is so near the metro. I find it very value-for-money and would highly recommend it for the budget conscious traveller whom also values comfort. The free wifi access was not

Reviews.Title: “A quiet "home" in busy Paris”
Reviews.Author: Alex_hcbing
Reviews.Content: A quiet and cozy little hotel on Rue de l'Avre tucked away from the main bustling street of Boulevard de Grenelle. We stayed for a total of 6 nights in April 2011. What's to like and love: Hotel itself - Decent, clean, quiet and cozy rooms. Absolutely gracious and friendly staff. Speaks good English. Breakfast consists of French baguettes, croissants (very very nice), yogurt, orange juice, choice of strawberry or apricot jam and of course good French coffee! Location - Hotel is located on a quiet street. Considerably safe and hotel reception is manned 24hrs. Less than 5mins walk to La Motte-Picquet - Grenelle Metro. Only 10mins walk to Eiffel Tower. There's Monoprix (supermarket) on Boulevard de Grenelle nearby. Great French restaurants along Avenue de La Motte-Picquet. Try La Gitane. What's (maybe) not to like: Typically small rooms but that's considerably common in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great value, great people = Great experience !”
Reviews.Author: trilobite1102
Reviews.Content: We just recently stayed at this wondeful hotel located in the 15th arrondisement in Paris. I read the reviews before I booked it and I am so glad I did. This hotel is everything the reviews portray it as. While it was sometimes difficult explaining to taxi drivers where the hotel was located, that was mostly due to my mis-pronunciation of the French language. Apparently I was having difficulty wrapping my Ls around my Rs. That being said, however you pronounce it, this is a great hotel for its location and value. The staff is outstanding; they are very friendly and very helpful. We needed a slight repair to our toilet and the issue was repaired by the time we returned. When was the last time you saw a plumber work that fast? While the rooms are not huge, they are clean and comfortable and very nicely decorated. The bathrooms are not huge, but the tub with shower was large with a great showerhead. Breakfast each morning consisted of coffee or tea with juice, croissants, baguettes and jam or marmalade, butter, cream cheese and yogurt. It was a very tasty and filling start to your day. Served in the garden courtyard, you felt more like you were in a private home or villa. All in all, I will definetly stay here again and I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a quiet and peaceful place to stay in busy frantic Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Calm after the storm”
Reviews.Author: Bar&Mar
Reviews.Content: After a hectic day out and about in the madness of Paris this hotel is a welcome sight. The staff are very helpful and understanding if your French is not that fluent or even non-existent. Our room was at the front and smaller than those overlooking the garden to the rear. But the room rental reflects this. The hotel is very clean and well maintained. We booked room only basis and never had breakfast in the hotel as we wanted to sample the cafe lifestyle of Paris. But basic breakfast (continental style) is available. They also have a vending machine with bottles of water, cans of soft drink and a limited supply of snacks. There are loads of cafes in the area and some can be a bit expensive. Check the tariff boards before entering. There are also lots of varied restuarants in the area ranging from McDonalds, Pizza Hut, Chinese, Japanese, Thai, Indian, Italian (lots) and traditional and modern French. But if you want to go further afield the "overland" railway and Metro stations are at the top of the street. If you happen to be there on a Sunday morning there is a fantastic food market under the railway arches. There is also a very nice shopping street around the corner. The Eiffel tower is a leisurely 20 minutes walk away. No complaints about this great find.

Reviews.Title: “Spill Cost Us €80”
Reviews.Author: tallmanirl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean and well kept. The staff are very friendly and have good English. However, when my mam spilt some whiskey on the wooden floor of the room. The main stain was about the size of a hand.she was told the wood would have to be replaced and charged €80. This is ridiculous! Even though they have signs asking people not t bring food up. Everyone brings some food and drink up, eg water. "Breakfast" consists of croissants and coffee, nothing else. Re internet access, the computer they gave me to print out my boarding pass crashed so often it took 2 hours to do. I don't think the antivirus was up to date either, so I wouldn't be confident of internet security on it.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet, clean, cosy!”
Reviews.Author: CCJ2010
Reviews.Content: V impressed with the area bring within walking distance of the Eiffel tower, invalides and also the area itself full of nice cafes less than 2 mins away, as is the metro. Excellent staff. Lovely decor that gave the impression the owners care about the place. Just perfect for a budget much better than expected. Breakfast can be bought up to room at request - croissants, juice, bread and jams with tea and coffee. Perfect for those doing lots of exploring. We stayed in room 28 and had a fabulous time in Paris. Would recommend! God bless you.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: LouWheeze
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful and spoke excellent English. The room was small but had everything we needed and the road outside was not noisy. We thought that the location was brilliant as it is close to the metro and has many restaurants, cafes and shops nearby. The value for money was excellent as you would pay much more had it been closer to the centre of Paris, however we liked the fact that the area was not touristy. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect getaway!”
Reviews.Author: muetzkugel
Reviews.Content: We've stayed there for three nights for a short honeymoon-trip. The rooms were small but really nice with a typical french-touch. It was clean and the service was good. Breakfast was good (although only consisting of baguettes, croissants, creme cheese and butter) and served in the nice, quiet garden. The Metro was a 3 minute walk from the hotel, a lot of shops were situated in the next street. We highly recommend staying at hotel de l' Avre.

Reviews.Title: “A little over priced for what you get.”
Reviews.Author: benandkristyh
Reviews.Content: At the end of the day it is a 2 star hotel so you can’t really expect much. The room was small, clean and tidy. However for €100 a night a think a little pricey for what it was. The location isn’t too bad right next to a metro so easy to get to places plus walking distant to Les Invalides & Eiffel Tower. The 3rd day we had gotten back to our room about 2.30pm for a afternoon break and it still hadn’t been made up so we didn’t get it done that day which was a touch annoying. Soap, Shampoo & Conditioner is all in one so don’t do my mistake and bring your own! Breakfast can be provided but we include it. Overall, wouldn’t go back as pay an extra €20 and you can get a fair nicer place!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: jofalcone
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to La Motte Picquet metro stop, which was an easy transfer from the RER from CDG airport. We stayed in a double room facing the street on the 4th floor. No problem with noise. Bed was not comfortable. Every time you move, you could hear the spring. Shower is about 27inch x 27inch. There is a laptop with free internet in the lobby for guests to use. Hotel is near a Monoprix supermarket and a McDonald's. Good value for an expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: caitlinskye
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the garden side of the hotel, and it was great! It was right across from a Metro station, but the garden side was away from the traffic so it was quiet, its a nice walk to almost anything you wanted to go to, and the location in ways of closeness to the Eiffel Tower was superb.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: kmcclinchey
Reviews.Content: This clean and cosy hotel is located on a quiet side street only blocks from the Eiffel Tower and steps away from a metro station. The staff were very friendly and spoke French slowly for my benefit; they provided a lovely breakfast to start our day. Our room was a good size with a full bathroom and had large windows that opened onto a quiet, leafy courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: racheerachh
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really cute. It's within walking distance of a few metro stations and the Eiffel Tower. You have to leave your key with the management when you leave and pick it up again when you come back, which is sort of shady, but we didn't have anything stolen and the staff was v. helpful and friendly. The hotel is in a semi-secluded street which is nice, and rooms have balconies overlooking the street, which makes it feel v. "Paris"-like and romantic. I recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for budget travellers”
Reviews.Author: Kenji_suppitsu
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed in this Hotel during our Euro trip in June 2010. Our first stop was in London and Paris was our second. The hotel itself was very well located to the Metro, walking distance to mcdonalds and a very huge supermarket at the corner. The staff working in the hotel are friendly and they speak english . We stayed for 4 nights, and our room was by the garden.There wasn't any air condition in the room, there is a standing fan given to us, but the room was way too cramp with our luggage and stuff. It was a wrong choice to pick the room by the garden, because mosquitos flew in and never get out when we open the window, the tree is just next to our room. The bathroom was a hazard itself, because there is no handle whatsoever for us to hold on in order to get out from the shower. I almost lost my balance and fall. The lift itself is a blessing, because i was told many budget accomodation doesn't have elevator serving their floor. The elevator can only fit two person and one small piece of luggage. Meaning , when we were assigned to our room on the first day, we made a total of 3 trips, from the lobby and to our room. We requested for 2 extra pillows, but only manage to get 1. There is no tea making facility and no such thing as tea bags and coffix mix and no mineral water provided. You are kinda like , "on your own" The LCD tv is fix to the wall, it was pretty hung high up,and we got to lift up our head in order to watch tv programmes, after ten minutes, our neck starts to ache, and its better to switch off the tv completely, trust me, its going to be occupational health issue, if i strained my neck. If you are on a budget, like you can only afford maximum 80 Euro per night, then this hotel is a pretty decent choice, because out of the 80 euro you are paying, 40 euro is for the location, which is near the metro,mcdonalds. the remaining 40 euro is for the friendly service staff, a place to sleep and to shower. This is Paris,you cant expect too much if you are on a budget !

Reviews.Title: “Very nice apart from small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Erichero
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a lot going for it, with very few downsides. I'll get the downsides out of the way: small rooms, small bathrooms, meaning that you'll need to keep your luggage organised to have some space for manoeuvre. The other thing is that breakfast is not included. Everything else is good: location right near an important metro stop (La Motte), walking distance from Eiffel Tower, location in the normal residents' area of Paris meaning that you have access to better prices. The styling is really pleasant with soft colours and the TV includes an extensive channel list. The location is on a quiet street which keeps noise down, and the service was always attentive. Free wifi included. Here's a small tip: if you're looking for a street side breakfast, walk down Rue du Commerce until you see a cafe called something like Cafe du Commerce next to a small park with the Commerce metro stop. You'll get a breakfast for 5.50 instead of the usual 8-10 you pay elsewhere. Also, if you're trying to keep your food costs down, there are two Chinese restaurants in the area where you'll pay about 6 euros for a good meal instead of the usual 10-15 everywhere else. And then there's also Mcdonalds just down the road, where you can eat big on a limited budget.

Reviews.Title: “Less than I expected”
Reviews.Author: Rinatan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for just one night with my teenage daughter. I had read pretty good reviews and so decided upon this one. Although I was prepared for Paris hotel rooms to be small and basic, this one was really just ok. The bathroom badly planned making it very difficult to use but that wasn't what bothered me. It was so hot and so noisy that neither of us slept at all. There were people stomping around outside our room until late at night. The man at the reception was exceptionally unhelpful. We needed an extra sheet since the thick blankets provided were way too hot to use with no AC but even a sheet was not made available. The room was clean and neat though so that was nice. Also the metro station is really close by and that's convenient. All in all I think we could've stayed at a much nicer place for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what you want for a true Paris experience”
Reviews.Author: nicoleschwarz
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews I didnt really hesitate in booking this one. Wonderful value for money, typical of what I had always thought Paris would be like and the staff were beyond wonderful. Very safe place. Very friendly and helpful. The garden is just beautiful and relaxing...the bathrooms and rooms are very clean. Bed was also comfortable. Thanks for a wonderful experience. Also, the location was fabulous. 200 metres or so from Eiffel Tower..and the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Vous êtes très gentil!”
Reviews.Author: seabeach08
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the end of March 2010. During my stay the hotel staff were very kind and friendly. I wish the room wall were thick and the shower room had more space. They say the breakfast is expensive but it seems other hotels charge almost the same price in Paris .

Reviews.Title: “Good value true French hotel”
Reviews.Author: SydneyFrancophile
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after having had several trips to Paris when we always stayed in the 15th arrondissement to keep clear of high-priced tourist areas or more sleazy districts. From past experience, we particularly wanted a quiet street, and payed the extra for a garden-side room. The hotel and staff were all we could have wanted to make this our base for an in-depth 10-day Paris visit. Although we have some French, we found the level of English very good among management staff, the room and bathroom of good size, and the location, 5 minutes from a really good metro station at Motte Piquet-Grenelle, really good. It is also a reasonable taxi ride from Gare Montparnasse, which is a drop off for buses from Charles de Gaulle airport. While not right in the centre of the city, metro transport makes it a very satisfactory location, and the Eiffel Tower is about 15 min walk anyway. Breakfast is a bit more expensive than available at local cafes, but ample and nicely served. We preferred to start each day that way. There are plenty of good reasonably priced restaurants not far away for evening meals. A computer was provided free for reasonable periods of Internet use. We would definitely recommend this hotel to people looking for clean, comfortable well- located accommodation, at a genuine 2-star standard without frills, in a residential part of Paris. If you want more class, you will pay a lot more. It depends on your taste.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Paris”
Reviews.Author: MiaMew
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Paris. I had searched for hotels in Paris and the price was so expensive. We paid 92 euros per night for a room with a bath, so it's still affordable. We stayed in the hotel for 2 nights. The staff were very friendly. We arrived at noon and the check in was not until 2pm, but they offered to keep our luggage until the room was ready. The room was small and quite oldish but comfortable and quite clean. The bed and pillows were comfortable. The sound proofing was not so good but the hotel is located in a quiet area. The location is great too. 2 minutes to metro.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel de l'Avre, je t'aime.”
Reviews.Author: marciabowie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for the 7th and 8th times on two separate occasions in August. After finding the Hotel de l'Avre a few years ago I won't stay anywhere else in Paris. Most importantly, the beds are fantastically comfortable. The hotel is pretty, rooms are adequate size, nice spacious bathrooms (those with bath - I haven't stayed in those with shower only), the staff are very welcoming and kindly put up with one's attempts at speaking french(!), and the location is brilliant. The street it's on is quiet, but the nearest metro station is a minute away at the end of the street, there are many cafes and restaurants within a couple of minutes walk, the Champ de Mars is 5 mins away where we spent many hours picnicking and generally looking at the Eiffel Tower (there are bakeries and shops aplenty nearby for buying provisions). Highly recommended - like I said, I won't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Caiybpf
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for our 5 days stay in Paris because of good reviews in TripAdvisor. Once again, we weren’t disappointed. From our point of view the best thing about this hotel was the location: surrounding area is pretty original without notable tourist hustle and bustle, still there are enough shops and restaurants for everyday needs. Metro station is also almost next door and connections from there are great. Hotel itself was clean and well kept. Rooms and lobby looks really nice and most of the staff was also super helpful. The little garden was also charming although we didn’t spend much time there. Biggest negative thing was the noise coming through the wall from the building next to hotel, but I guess it was on a pretty normal level if compared to other old buildings in bigger cities. Few times we also had some communication problems with some staff members, but somehow we always managed to solve our problems. Overall hotel was really nice for two starts hotel. However, if you are a bit bigger person or desire some extra comfort, make sure that you can fit into the shower stall of your room (if you have one) as at least some of those are super tiny.

Reviews.Title: “More than we had expected”
Reviews.Author: Zsofi-Budapest
Reviews.Content: We just returned today from Paris where we spent 5 days, and wanted to add a review of this beautiful hotel. Staff: I booked our accommodation a month ahead, for our anniversary, and communication between us and the hotel was great from the very beginning. They do speak English, although the night shift does a little less but we managed to communicate without any problem. The gentleman who we think was the boss there is very helpful both with hotel issues and tourist information, and to top everything to be expected, they were happy to change our room from their recommendation to what we would have liked to have. Location: excellent, there is a metro station at the end of the street, which is indeed very quiet, Tour Eiffel and Ecole Militaire within walking distance, plus the metro takes you anywhere is Paris within 20 minutes. Supermarche Monoprix on the second corner, opposite a McDonald's where we had our morning coffees, but the hotel offers breakfast as well (no other meals but you would have dinner in one of the many restaurants nearby or somewhere in the city anyways). Velib bicycles available in the next street, but you need a chip card or a Navigo pass to borrow one, the machine doesn't work with "normal" bank/credit cards. Rooms/bathroom: aaaaaaah, beautiful, the main reason why we chose this hotel. Lovely decoration, comfy bed. Ours was on the garden, but street ones also very quiet, almost no cars in the street. Wall cushions so you can sit and lay back, extra pillows in the closet, where there are also hangers for your clothes, plus a fan in case the weather is too hot. Bathroom with a bath tub is spacious, towels are changed daily, there's a hair drier, and you can use liquid soap both at the sink and in the tub. There's a small glass wall at the head of the tub so if you take a shower, the floor doesn't get wet. Not the latest enterieur, but we had everything we needed. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone, and hope to come again!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: mareka2
Reviews.Content: The staff were very helpful and very friendly. They let us store our luggage. They let us use an iron and stored my wife's insulin for her in a refrigerator. We had breakfast in the garden area and enjoyed it thoroughly. It was about a block from the metro. The hotel was older but clean and it had personality. Our room looked out over a quiet street and we enjoyed watching people pass on the street below.

Reviews.Title: “Couldnt Ask For better”
Reviews.Author: Bruma09
Reviews.Content: Well if you are going o paris u must stay at this hotel , its perfect in allmost every way ,the rooms are amazing and so well cleaned , the location is perfect and the staff very very kind and for the price i really think it couldnt get any better , me and my gf felt like we were at home i really recomend this hotel to everyone i was really and trully amazed , in our next trip to paris we are staying there again for SURE ! hope you this tip usefull

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!!!! :)”
Reviews.Author: EmmaM0704
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved Hotel de l'Avre! I just moved to Paris, France and stayed there for two nights while I looked for a place to live permanently. I really enjoyed my stay there! Everyone who works there is incredibly kind! They are really what made my stay so great! They were helpful with so many things! The gentleman at the desk (I believe he owns the hotel) helped me with getting around the city and clearly explained everything. He also answered my questions about parts of town that I should live in. The young woman at the desk was so sweet! I had to buy a new cell phone in France and she helped me activate my account, since I do not speak French very well. She also called me a taxi when I was moving my things. The room was very clean and very comfortable! I really enjoyed staying there and wish I could have stayed longer! Room 45 is very nice :) I read one or two bad reviews of the hotel - but please ignore these! My experience was so pleasant! The hotel has wireless internet and an elevator which is great! It also has delicious chocolates downstairs for guests - try one of these each day! I only noticed them on the last day and I wish I would have noticed them the first day! They were the best chocolates I've ever had! They change daily, I believe :) Overall, this is a great hotel and it is not very expensive. I would recommend it to anyone. I really liked the location, as well. It is great for couples, singles, or families :) Hotel de l'Avre is excellent :) Enjoy your stay in France!! :) Au Revoir!

Reviews.Title: “Average experience”
Reviews.Author: punky21
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hotel de l'Avre was average and nothing unexpected. Some thougts: - the rate was really good (82 euros per night) - breakfast (8 euros per person) consists of croissants, bread, coffee/tea, jam and orange juice. It is substantial (all that bread and butter is delicious) but you lose out on the "French cafe experience" - staff didn't speak much English but you shouldn't expect them to... you are in FRANCE - conveniently located right next to a metro station and walking distance from the Eiffel Tower. What we learned though is that staying near the Eiffel Tower is not the best bet. We will try to stay near Arc de Triomphe or Saint Michel during our next trip to Paris - tiny room with tiny shower and tiny television - but we only needed the room to sleep - walls are quite thin and my husband woke up in the morning from all the other guests waking up and going about their business TIP - there are a few shelves full of guide books that guests must have left at the hotel. I wish we noticed these in the beginning of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value b&b in central paris”
Reviews.Author: tiredmonkey
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel through tripadvisor and I'm really glad I did. When I was looking at b&bs on other sites to book and then checking the reviews on tripadvisor there were so many bad reviews. My husband and I went for the weekend to Paris and it was a great weekend. The b&b is clean, well kept, very close to the Eiffel Tower but in a quiet side street - we didn't have any problems with noise. There is someone on duty all the time so you feel quite safe. The staff were friendly too. The room wasn't huge but it was a decent enough size for the weekend. We had a bathroom with a bath and the bathroom seemed adequate for our needs and it was clean. The bed was comfy too. The hotel is quite near the metro stop and it's on the main lines to most of the sites around Paris. The staff speak good English and I book it directly with them via email. There is a little chocolaterie that we had breakfast in - near the metro station. Its cheaper and better value than the b&b breakfast (we had this the day we were leaving as we had an early flight), although in typical parisian fashion they do just throw the breakfast at you in the chocolaterie!

Reviews.Title: “Great price in a great location”
Reviews.Author: coolaunt52
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel de l'Avre for 4 nights and were very pleased. We did opt for the slightly larger bathroom when we booked, whatever we ended up with was very good sized. Our room was on the street side but we didn't have any problems with noise at night. The hotel does have an elevator, great for getting luggage to the rooms. We never sampled any food at the hotel, great dining options and a really nice grocery store are right around the block and we used those options for meals instead. The location is wonderful, a nice stroll to the Eiffel Tower & just a block away from a Metro station to get to other parts of the city. The staff was always pleasant and helpful, I would definitely stay here again if I'm lucky enough to return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for great price!”
Reviews.Author: Mil974
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights at the hotel and we found it excellent! We even found the bathroom and the room very comfortable. The hotel was clean and well located, close to train/tube station and just few minuts by walking from Les Invalides and Eiffel Tower. We definetly recommend it! If I come back to Paris one day, I would stay there again!.

Reviews.Title: “superb”
Reviews.Author: Daglass
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights&it really is fantastic.Excellent location,theres a metro station at the top of the street,from which you can acess anywhere in paris(no noise can be heard).Also a few nice places to eat nearby,especially the cafe du commerce.The staff were always helpful&friendly.Room was very clean&quite spacious.Can't recommend it enough,a great place to stay in paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good location; would stay again”
Reviews.Author: saraallison11
Reviews.Content: I was looking for the following things in a hotel: Private bath, clean, affordable price, good location, quiet. This hotel is directly across from a metro stop. It's down a quiet street (alley), so not too noisy. We were able to afford a room with a private bath because it was not too expensive. (The bathroom was closet-size, but we didn't care.) And the place was clean. So it met those expectations. For those things, I would stay here again. On the negative side, the staff was not very helpful or friendly, and one day we returned at lunch to find our door wide open. The maid was down the hall, in the process of cleaning the upstairs rooms, but it made me feel a little unsafe to know our door was open to anyone who happened down the hall. Also, strangely enough, the maid (we think) stole some (stinky) cheese we had bought. My husband had bought it and frankly, I was glad to be rid of it, but it was still a bit disconcerting. Again, I would stay here again because it meets my top priorities. You can stay closer in to the city center, but you're going to get less for your money. This place is about a 10 min pleasant walk to Eiffel. There is a nice grocery store just down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic time”
Reviews.Author: Citytraveler76
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the weekend for the Springsteen concert from thursday to sunday. The location was exellent in our opion, metro just 2 minutes away and also Monoprix supermarket just around the corner. The rooms was very clean and spacious we thought, although they had some handymen doing some refurb in the hotel. During the evening we bought own food in Monoprix together with wine and sat in the lovely green garden on the backside. Would we stay here again ? yes indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: fearlesschickgoforth
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location. The metro is only a block away. There are restaurants, a supermarket and an open air market within a few blocks. The neighborhood felt safe event at night. Overall it was a good stay. The rooms were definiately on the small side. The shower was also quite small. There wasn't much room to bend over and pick up a bottle of shampoo on the stall floor. Make sure you bring earplugs. This is a strange but true problem. The keys and doorlocks are very loud. I was woken up at night and in the morning by neighbors unlocking their doors. I had breakfast one day. I recommend going to a nearby patissiere instead. The hotel breakfast was only ok and expensive. The staff was friendly and helpful. For two stars I thought it was a good value. I stayed at a 3 star a few months ago in Paris and it wasn't nearly as nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good!”
Reviews.Author: KeyserSweden
Reviews.Content: A small but nice hotel at close range to the Eifeltower. The metro is just 2 minutes away. Even though the rooms are pretty small it´s good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Kwickdraw9
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just as charming as the photos show. Very clean and nicely decorated, felt quite safe and comfortable there. By American standards, the rooms are a bit small, but I think they are probably typical for Europe, and they contained everything you need (I live in a studio, so I'm all for minimal...) We thought the location was fantastic: an easy walk to the Eiffel tower, and transit was close by. I found the hotel by chance while I was reading a bad review for a hotel I ALMOST booked...thank god for TripAdvisor, because we loved this place. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing better for the price!”
Reviews.Author: WhitG525
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly an amazing deal for the price. $90/night and only 3 blocks from the Eiffel Tower! There is a convenient metro stop nearby to access the other sites of Paris. It is a very safe-feeling neighborhood- my husband and I strolled the streets late into the night walking home from the Eiffel Tower. The hotel doesn't serve breakfast, but there are bakeries/grocery stores nearby to buy fruit, croissants, etc. The hotel staff was very courteous and spoke English well. There is complimentary internet access on a laptop in the lobby. The rooms are small but sufficient and have private bathrooms. All in all, We loved our stay there and would most definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't imagine a better place!”
Reviews.Author: BuddhaRunner
Reviews.Content: Superb experience! Ultra close to restaurants, bakeries, banks, a metro hub, and within walking distance to major sites. Hotel staff are extremely friendly and all speak English quite well. Friendly and patient enough they'll let you practice your French. They will give you great touring information, help you select the best metro route(s). Skip the breakfast. There is a great boulangerie a couple of blocks away and right across from the metro station. I woukld often get my breakfast (croissant, great quiche which they'll heat for you) and pick up a sandwich to carry with me for lunch. On the weekend next door is a creperie. Also a VERY tasty breakfast which will cost you less than half of what the hotels charge for breakfast. There are others nearby as well, including a great patisserie. Lots of ethnic food within 1-2 blocks, too. I ate twice at the Indian/Pakistan restaurant en route to the metro. Across from the staion is a Spanish restaurant with excellent paella. If you're like me and like to stay away from the tourist spots, this is your place. You'll see daily life and still be close to the must-see places. The metro station is where major lines cross. It's really hard to beat this location. Rooms were eurotypical, although I agree with another poster that the shower was larger than most. I had a room facing the street, and even with the window open noise wasn't a real problem. There is a quaint spiral staircase but also an elevator. If you aren't used to it, you don't take the key with you when you leave the hotel. Leave it at the front desk. When you return, give them your room number, and they give you the key. Kind of nice actually, esp since they're bulky. On the weekend there is also a marche de puce (flea market) by the metro station. It's fun to walk around and check things out there. Some good deals as well. Yet again a great place to see typical Parisian life. I HIGHLY recommend getting the museum pass if you plan on going to see more than one of the museums or monuments. It saved me hours of waiting in line since the more popular places have special lines for pass holders. In one case, at the Rodin museum, they were closed for a special event; however, if you had a pass, you could still get in and get full access. So it's worth the money. There are numerous places you can buy them. I went to Versailles, went to the C gate and bought my pass there. Super short line, and once you enter there you have easy access everywhere. I also recommend the carte orange (metro pass). Get the zone 1-5 for just a tad bit more, and there's virtually nowhere you can't go, which includes to and from the airport. It covers buses and the funiculaire at Montmartre which will save you a steep climb up to Sacre Coeur, which is a good idea if you plan on climbing the stairs to the dome. Can't recommend this hotel enough. I'm going again next year, and this time taking my son, and I will be staying here for sure.

Reviews.Title: “I recommend it (but without breakfast)”
Reviews.Author: Marjuuu
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of the location (business trip), free Wifi (ask for the login name and password from the reception) and very reasonable price (67 EUR single room). The hotel surprised me in a good way: not too small rooms, you could say that the bathroom was quite big in the Paris sense, room decoration looked nice and new, everything was clean. Only thing that I did not like was the 8-EUR-breakfast: 1 croissant and 1 other roll, jam, butter + hot and cold drink of your choice – that’s it! The wifi signal was not the strongest (second floor) and the connection was cut off a few times.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulously Quaint”
Reviews.Author: misskoka
Reviews.Content: The Hotel de l'Avre is an excellent hotel. We know of two other couples who have stayed and had the same enjoyable and pleasant experience that we had while staying there. We booked a garden view room that was spacious, clean, beautifully decorated, and well maintained. We found our room to be quiet, private, and quaint. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Most importantly, the location of the Hotel de l'Avre is incredible. We were a ten minute walk from the Eiffel Tower, a block away from a great shopping district, and moments away from dozens of restaurants, cafes, bistros, and bars. The closest metro stop is 'La Motte-Picquet-Grenelle,' and it is a five minute walk from the hotel. If you are looking for a charming, clean, and quaint little hotel, this is it! We truly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain in great neighborhood in Paris”
Reviews.Author: CathyFrance
Reviews.Content: I have used the Hotel de l’Avre numerous times for out-of-town guests (including my mother and my grandmother) coming to visit me in Paris. If someone else can find a hotel of similar quality for a similar price with a location in a neighborhood as nice as this with transportation connections that are as convenient, I would be very interested to know the name, because in my opinion these are l’Avre’s strengths, and they are a rare combination. (I have been living in Paris for over 10 years.) First, for a European capital city, it is very inexpensive considering the location. Yes, rooms are small, but this is not a 5-star hotel, and even in most European 5-stars, Americans would find the rooms small. European size standards are different. The rooms are spotlessly clean and if you ask for one on the garden side, very quiet. Even on the street side noise is minimal. The bathrooms are also very clean. Second, you are within a 10 minute walk of the Eiffel Tower, and the La Motte Piquet metro station encompasses 3 subway lines that will whisk you to pretty much anywhere you would want to be in Paris in under 20 minutes. You can get to the gorgeous Opera Garnier in less than 10 minutes on the line 8, or the Champs-Elysées in 15 minutes on the line 6 (if you go directly to the Etoile. Alternately, you could take the line 8 to Concorde and walk down the avenue for the view). Concorde is also the stop that takes you to the Tuileries Garden and the Louvre. The line 10 will put you in the heart of the Latin Quarter, get off at after 15 minutes at Odéon for the Luxembourg Gardens, Cluny La Sorbonne for exactly that or Maubert Mutualité for Notre Dame… I could go on and on but the location is really ideal. The rue du Commerce is appropriately named, with tons of shops on it, and the neighborhood has some very good, reasonably priced restaurants. My opinion of the staff varies. Some of the staff are *very* friendly and helpful, others are just adequate, doing their job satisfactorily but without going out of their way to be warm. The owner himself can sometimes be very charming and at other times somewhat cooler, but never rude. For travelers on a budget or those who believe that a hotel is just a place to sleep, not a social centre, and who prefer to spend the bulk of their time out visiting one of the world’s most beautiful cities, the Hotel de l’Avre is very good value for the money. Everyone I know who has stayed there liked it and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: andderalz
Reviews.Content: We are surprised at some of the negative comments as our experience with accommodations and staff was pleasant. Rooms 14 and 24 face the street which gets noisy during the day, but quiet at night. Splurge and get room 12 facing the garden with a modern bathroom. Perhaps room 22 is similar? Twin beds in 14 and 24 are very firm. ( Did not sleep in room 12). Our french is very limited, no problem , the main desk person speaks english, and was very helpful. Morning continental breakfast is 7 euros and convenient and in a pleasant surrounding, including a garden weather permitting. Credit cards accepted. Check with your bank, debit cards may be a cheaper way to go.. The hotel location is very convenient. A supermarked is just around the corner, with a great selection of ready to eat food and drinks for lunch. Overall the hotel De l'Avre and Paris in general were a very pleasant surprise. I suspect the experience may have something to do with your own willingness to be flexible.

Reviews.Title: “The price and quality cannot be beaten.”
Reviews.Author: Onelifeliveit
Reviews.Content: Being a Londoner I have been fortunate enough to have visited Paris some 20+ times and have stayed in many different types of hotels. For the price you pay, this place is an absolute find. I have stayed in St Germain, Marais and Monmartre but I have never stayed in the Eiffel Tower area and wanted to try something different. You really have to weigh it up. If you want to stay somewhere surrounded by quaint boutiques and restaurants i.e St Germain, be prepared to pay the price but the quality of hotels in relation to what you pay at Hotel de L’Avre will not be comparable. What I liked especially about the hotel besides the very personalised one to one customer service was the way you got to experience a little bit of true Parisian life for a very good price. Sitting out in the little garden in the evening with a glass of wine cannot be beaten. There were no problems with booking. I went to the hotel site direct and got a confirmation 24 hours later. The rooms were spotlessly clean and very comfortable. My only one small gripe is that I stayed in room no.1 which was right in the reception area and near to the lift and sometimes it can be a bit noisy with patrons coming home late although it only happened to me once at about midnight. The area is perfect and is so close to the metro station with three lines running in different directions. If you get off at La Motte please do not use the Rue Suffren exit, use the other as the hotel is nearer and literally across the street. The area around the hotel was perfect for a solo traveller like myself. There are cafes and restaurants where you can eat well and cheap for a fraction of the prices you’d pay in the more touristy areas. I did not eat in the hotel when you can get a coffee and croissant for 3 euro’s from the many café’s in the area. Another reviwer complained that the restaurants are pricey - not true. This area is quite residential and is not over run with tourist menus. I had a meal at Le Roi Du Couscous (North African) 112 Blvd de Grenelle for 12 euros including wine and the meal was HUGE, enough for two. At Cafe Peirrot (next to the metro) you can have a French breakfast of orange juice, hot drink, croissant, baguette and jam for 7 euro's. . It is a little way from the major sites but like I said if this is your first visit and you want to be within walking distance of the major Parisian sites or if you want a large room that feels like your own home, you may want to look elsewhere. I find that the chain hotels lack character. I will definitely stay at L’Avre again and will recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Quality but itchy”
Reviews.Author: TorontonianJune2007
Reviews.Content: Our first impression of the hotel was good. It looked clean, recently painted and touched up to look nice. The staff was very friendly too and the price very good for Paris. The only bad thing to say about this hotel was the red lumps I got from multiple bed bug bites. We checked the mattresses when we first arrived to be sure and they were very new. Throughout the first night we were both bitten twice and the next night I got another 8 bites. We didn't know what it was until we squished a few red-brown bugs full of our blood. After buying oitments in Paris and now seeing my Doctor he confirmed they're bed bugs. I showed the staff my bites while we were then and they said it had never happened before. We thought it was from out door bugs coming in through the window. I'd would not recommend this hotel for the summer or late spring as there is no Air Conditioning or fan to circulate air. You can only leave the screen-less french doors open and ensure mosquitos buzzing in the night as we had. It's only a 5 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower and seconds from nice (but pricy) restaurants. The location was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Get a confirmation!!!”
Reviews.Author: 57mass
Reviews.Content: I had made a reservation for last week during my stay in Paris. It wasn't until I arrived was I told that they had lost my reservation and they did not have any rooms available. I was very disappointed with the owners lack of professionalism. She basically threw us out of her lobby and said good luck. We were forced to walk down the street with our luggage and stay at a hotel that was a two star but dirty and unwelcoming. Yes, could have spent the time looking all over Paris for something nicer but I didnt want to waste my precious time in the city doing that so we sucked it up. MAKE SURE YOU GET A CONFIRMATION NUMBER FROM THEM BEFORE YOU GO!!! You dont want to be caught in a foreign country for the first time without a place to stay! For whatever it is worth, the eiffel tower area was a great location with the river, tower, Monoprix and Metro close by. I just wish we would have been able to have the hotel I had planned on. We ran ourselves ragged so we didn't have to stay in the yucky hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Stay”
Reviews.Author: DeanerEdmonton
Reviews.Content: Our stay was wonderful. The location is perfect with the metro and the Monoprix just steps away. Great neighborhood, very quiet street. The staff went over and above to help us. The rooms were a bit on the small side based on our North American expectations - but very clean. Would stay there again in a heart-beat.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: lb0423
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel disappointing. We paid 87EUR per night and thought it was not worth the money. Yes, the hotel is close to the Eiffel Tower (about a 10 min walk), but it is on the wrong side of the Champs du Mars. The other side of the tower has many more restaurants, markets, and better subway connections. After the first night I found bugs in my bed. Tiny rust-colored ones about the size of a pencil tip. It freaked me out and I could not sleep well for our remaining night. Also, we noticed the sign in the room that said the price for breakfast. I thought it was too high to charge for a quick breakfast so we asked the front desk clerk if breakfast was included in the room price. He said yes. The remaining days we ate at the hotel - 1 greasy croissant, 1 hard baguette with jam, and coffee. When we checked out we were upset to be charged 7.50EUR per person for each day that we ate breakfast. 100% not worth this price. At every corner bakery you can get a fresh pastry and a better coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pink_pirlie
Reviews.Content: The Hotel de l'Avre was recommended to me through the forum on this website and it did not disappoint. The hotel has a number of options on the type of room that you can book for your stay - rooms with bath, rooms with shower, rooms overlooking the courtyard, rooms overlooking the street etc - these all come at different prices. I had requested one of the cheapest options as we were staying on a budget - a room overlooking the street with a shower - this came out at 77 euro a night. The room itself was a good size and had a desk, wardrobe and chair. On arrival the room was quite hot. However, turning off the radiator and opening the window for half an hour solved this problem. The room was overlooking the road and was slightly noisy after 9am. You couldn't hear this if the window was shut, but I like to sleep with it open. I am however a very late riser so it wouldn't bother you if you wake before 9am. The staff at the hotel were friendly and helpful. In the lobby they provided Free internet access on a laptop. We did not have breakfast at the hotel, opting instead to get takeout pastries from one of the nearby patisseries. The location of the hotel was excellent. A short walk to the Eiffel Tower and on three metro lines for access to the rest of Paris. There were a number of supermarkets within a couple of minutes walk from the hotel, which were excellent for getting water and snacks. If I returned to Paris, I would definitely stay at this hotel again. I think I would opt for a room overlooking the courtyard if I wasn't on such a low budget as the room next to ours (which we saw when the maid was cleaning it) was very pretty.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place but wouldn't return”
Reviews.Author: saraallison
Reviews.Content: We booked through the hotel website, and just a warning, when they responded to me, they sent me an email, which included ALL the information I submitted, including my entire credit card number. I was not happy about that. So, I suggest calling them to book or faxing maybe. As for the hotel itself, it was well situated, on a street right across from La Motte-Picquet Grenelle metro stop. There was a Monoprix right around the corner, as well as some retail stores (Gap) and fast food places. The street was always quiet and we had no problem with noise at night. When we arrived, the room was not ready (we were early), but they kept our bags for us...in the stairwell that all the guests use. Didn't feel great about that, but didn't want to carry them around all day either. The lady that greeted us was not very communicative, and her English was not too fluent. Sadly our French is even worse, but from reviews on here, I was expecting to have no problem. Unfortunately, she was the most fluent in English of any other employee that we met. One man spoke absolutely no English. This would have been okay still, if they had been friendly at all. But they really were not, I'm disappointed to say. The room was fine. There are photos of it that others have posted here (it was the room with the red pillows hanging above the bed, on the wall). The bathroom was seriously small, the shower just big enough for me to turn around in. Still, it was adequate. One bonus, I loved the fan in the closet! I always sleep with a fan on at home, for the noise, so I was glad to have it. Not just for the noise, though...it was so humid in our room all the time! And, yes, we were there in Dec., and yes, it was cold outside! We would leave our window open too, but it just didn't quite do the job. So the fan helped. We had one strange occurrence. We bought bread, cheese, and meat for lunches, and we left it out on the window ledge so that it would stay cool. One lunchtime, we came back to find our door open, and inside, the window open (we always closed it while we were gone, so we knew someone else had opened it). The maid was down the hall, cleaning another room, and we waved at her to let her know we were going to be back in our room for a little bit. We gathered our food from the ledge and discovered that our cheese (a large, new wedge) was missing. Every other thing was still there. We looked down on the ground outside, knowing it was unlikely that it had fallen (there was a big rail thing on the ledge that would have prevented it, plus everything else was still there), and there was no sign of it. The only answer we could come up with, strange as it was, was that the maid had taken it! We were rather flabbergasted, and wanted to report it, but we had had enough of trying to communicate with the desk staff and were leaving the next day, so we let it go. Didn't leave us with a good impression though. I would not stay here again, most likely, although I might possibly stay in this area again.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel - friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: eellau
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel in a quiet area close to the Eiffel Tower in a very nice area of Paris. The staff were all friendly and were quite helpful when asked. They all spoke English although one or two didn't didn't speak it very well although they spoke it far better than my French. The rates were very competative too. The room was well kept and cleaned well. The only reason I didn't rate it as 5 stars was the small shower recess and being on the large size it made it a bit difficult.. My wife and I loved Paris and plan to return towards the end of 2007 and we also plan to rebook the Hotel De L'Avre.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: cpmwalker
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel de l'avre for three nights in late November, 2006. Overall, we had a very pleasant stay. Our room was a double with shower and toilet. Overall, we found it clean and well cared for. Though our room was a tad small, that is to be expected at a small budget hotel in Europe. The desk attendants were very helpful, giving us directions to ATMs, Internet access, and subway routes. We also had an early flights out of CDG (before the subway began to run), so they arranged for a cab to pick us up at 5a.m. As I said our room was clean and comfortable. Our only complaints were minor, and would not keep me from staying at the hotel again. First, the shower was tiny and had no shelves to put soap, shampoo or razors on. Plus, I kept accidentally turning the shower off with my elbow / hip / etc. because the stall was so small. But, the plus is there was always hot water. Second, we washed out some socks, undies, etc. in the sink the first night we were there, and they weren't totally dry when we checked out three days later because the room was so humid. We didn't find the fan until our last night (we thought it was a space heater). Overall, a great place to stay for the value. It is a little off the beaten path, but only a subway ride away from all the main attractions. I would stay again. We did not try the breakfast. Overall, a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and Friendly European boutigue hotel”
Reviews.Author: DepartfromRIC
Reviews.Content: Each email written with questions about the hotel's location or amenities was answered promptly by Bernard, the owner, whose English was perfected by his helpful answers. The location could not have been more perfect. On Wednesday and Sundays, there is an open air market not one block from the property. Stalls of fresh food and French pastries go on for blocks!! Another two short blocks away is the metro station which connects to all of Paris. The French version of a Walmart is the Monoprix which is another short block away and for those of you you have to have...McDonald's is around the corner. We had room 47; comfortable bed, and a large room by European standards. There is an elevator, daily maid service, and breakfast served in the lobby for a nominal price. The price is real and the quality is sincere. We had never been to Paris, found the hotel on a website talking about Paris best kept secret hotel deals. And we couldn't agree more. Bernard's English made every day's start a good one as we could discuss our options with him and listen to his suggestions.

Reviews.Title: “love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: gourmet2go
Reviews.Content: This is now where I always stay in Paris. Small hotel, smallish to medium rooms, some facing a sparse garden in the back, some on the street. Location is quiet except on the street you do hear some late night carousers talking loudly as they go home, especially weekends. Also, less than a block to the La Motte Piquet-Grenelle metro station...easy connection to anywhere in Paris. Good restaurants in the area. They have a charming breakfast area in the hotel, next to the reception desk, painted in bright yellow colors. Very good continental breakfast. All for under 100 Euros. Mme. Claudine Allard who is usually at the reception is a real gem. Always a warm welcome. The owner is M. Bernard Vialettes who is sometimes at the reception as well and always looking after his guests. This is not the Ritz, but it could easily be your home in Paris a few days each year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: docdanz
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! Sitting right on a metro stop at the intersection of 3 lines (i.e. get almost anywhere with no transfers) and with a Monoprix supermarket 2 minutes away, this is an excellent budget choise for a stay in Paris. Sure it isn't in the very centre of Old Paris but even there you will have to use the metro frequently so being close to a convenient stop is a must. We paid 77 euros a night and got a very clean and tidy room, decor slightly more plain than the photos but still modern. Service was reasonable but we didn't spent much time conversing with the staff so can't really comment on that. They did loan us some wine glasses to drink our wine in the cute back garden however. Ate at a Bistrot on the corner by the metro and had an okay meal, but didn't compare with any of the meals we had in Bordeaux. (and they were cheaper too). No air con but we didn't need it and there was a fan. Sattelite TV was appreciated. Only negative was finding it but that was my fault for misreading the map when we exited the metro stop. Unfortunately had exited the furtherest metro exit from the hotel then had my bearings about 90 degrees out. We visited an internet cafe and found out there we were literally 2 minutes from it all the time. D'oh! Would definitely stay here again and recommend for any other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but a little twee for my tastes!”
Reviews.Author: davidcalgary29
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms at the Hotel de L'Avre after reading some of the glowing reviews on this site, and -- largely -- concur with the previous comments made about this property. The hotel is located in a wonderful district just steps away from the La Motte -- Grenelle metro station, and only 1 km from the Eiffel Tower, and is therefore a great choice for tourists. While the hotel itself is quite small and charming, it's not equipped with many modern amenities, and is not competitive with most modern business/superior class hotels. I was personally quite put off by the decor in my room, which looked like it had been decorated for a fussy old lady, but my middle-aged friend (female), found it to be "quaint". The hotel was located in a very quiet area of Paris, but you'll still likely experience some street noise. I was woken up two nights in a row by loud pedestrians around 3 a.m., and the garbage was picked up on Saturday around 6 a.m. While it's true that few tourists would want to spend much of their vacation in bed, light sleepers should think about brining along a pair of earplugs. The staff was quite pleasant, and you really shouldn't encounter any problems at check-in (or anywhere in Paris, for that matter), if you have basic French skills. For nearly 8 Euros, the morning breakfasts were quite overpriced, and I simply skipped them and went to one of the wonderful local patisseries instead. Tip: there's a wonderful local market underneath the metro station on Sunday mornings. The offered food at some of the stalls was simply incredible, and it's a good place to pick up last-minute souvenirs, regional French street food, clothing, flowers, and cheese.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff makes you feel at home”
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel de l'Avre alone, in room 25, a small, but spotlessly clean single room facing the street, which was surprisingly quiet. I have stayed in several budget hotels in different parts of Paris. There are more centrally located budget hotels in Paris, especially if you are heading for Beauborg, Notre-Dame, or the Marais and Bastille quarters. But the 7th arrondissement, where Hotel de l'Avre is located, is a peaceful, mainly residential neighbourhood, with nice cafes and restaurants. Crucially for me, staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful, much more than in all other hotels where I had stayed before. Breakfast is quite good, too. The only thing I missed was a socket in the bathroom for shavers.

Reviews.Title: “Great discovery in Paris”
Reviews.Author: vtm
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at Hotel de L'Avre, and it was even better the second time. The first time we stayed in the street view rooms, and we founds the rooms quite small but overall it was very pleasant. This time we booked the rooms overlooking the garden and they were excellent. The rooms were large and the bathrooms were terrific. The front desk staff was very helpful and allowed me to practice my French, but spoke English as well to help when things went beyond my level of French. The breakfast in the garden is the highlight of the holiday. It is a nice peaceful way to start the day. The location is great, near the Metro, Tour Eiffel, lots of shops and restaurants and a twice weekly market. (Sundays and Wednesdays). We have recommended it to many friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Paris”
Reviews.Author: Dixo
Reviews.Content: We spent six days at the Hotel de l'Avre during the recent hot spell in Paris. Our room was clean, colourful and, best of all, convenient to so many restaurants that we ate at a different one each nite. We especially enjoyed sitting in the hotel's pretty garden in the late afternoon with a bottle of wine--we met interesting people from all over the world! On our first morning, we walked to the Eiffel Tower --an easy and pleasant walk. We were close to the subway station and to a laundromat. All members of the staff were helpful and knowledgeable. We highly recommend this lovely hotel! When we visit Paris in the future, we will definitely stay at the Hotel de l'Avre. Diane and Rob, Coquitlam, BC, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice”
Reviews.Author: GenieL
Reviews.Content: My niece and I spent 3 nights at this hotel at the beginning of August. The room was tiny but this is Paris and the hotel is, for Paris, quite reasonable. While the room in reality was not quite as pretty as the very flattering pictures on the hotel's homepage led me to believe, the furnishings were tasteful with some nice old pieces and nothing from Ikea. The beds were comfortable and did not sag. Everything was clean and everything worked except the lamp on the desk. Our room on the 4th floor faced the street and was very quiet. The view from our window was very nice. Now that most hotels in Europe offer a breakfast buffet that is normally included in the price of the room, I was surprised to find the old-fashioned breadstuff-butter-marmelade version at a price of almost 7 Euros per person. We considered going elsewhere but considering Paris prices decided that the same modest breakfast would probably have cost about the same in a café and there is a certain comfort to having breakfast in the hotel. The coffee was very good, typical French coffee with warm milk to add to one's own taste. The other breakfast ingredients were of very good quality: decent glass of juice, a really good croissant, a large piece of a crusty baguette, two pats of butter, individual jar of good marmelade, individual serving of cream cheese. Maybe the staff didn't all speak English but they were patient with my less-than-fluent French. As other reviewers have said, the location is excellent, with good local infrastructure and 2-3 minutes from a Métro station that is served by three lines. The one problem I would like to mention is something I have encountered in many hotels. In the bathroom there will be a sign asking you to consider protecting the environment by re-using your towels. I would be delighted to comply, if there were a place to hang up the towel so that it could dry. I really don't like to use a towel that is still damp from yesterday's shower. All in all, I would recommend this hotel as a good value in a high-price city, and I would also come back.

Reviews.Title: “Not all it's up to be”
Reviews.Author: superwell
Reviews.Content: I hate to be negative about this place but there were a few things that didn't pan out as said by others or even room pictures. First off, it's in a great location close to metro and many restaurants and such. The hotel wasn't hard to find and is within 3 minute walk from the metro. Check in was good and most of them speak english alright, there is a one older man that speaks it the best and has the most knowledge, so ask him for anything as the rest were useless. Upon getting our room we were shocked, a very small and plain room and nothing like the pictures that are posted here for this hotel..no colour in the room..dirty baseboards. Anyway it was liveable so we stayed as the price is decent for the location. There is no air conditioning and after our first night we asked for a fan and were told that they didn't have any even though they had 4 empty boxes for fans by the stairs, next night after coming home from dinner we see that reception has a fan for themselves, so we asked them why we don't have one and they do, and we were looked at like we were asking for the world and then we got a stupid comment about "we should have one in the room already" SO we brought her up to have a look as she thought we were trying to get 2 fans. Overall i am not impressed with this place and at 75 euro a night for a double i think you can find many better places.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Choice for Paris!”
Reviews.Author: jennifey
Reviews.Content: My husband, two young boys (4, 6) and I stayed at the Hotel de l'Avre for 3 nights, loved it and would definitely return. The hotel's location is ideal as it is steps away from a Metro station, and also a good shopping area. We stayed in Room 2, the family room on the main floor, and it was quiet, extremely clean and charming. The windows opened onto the garden.
