The only downfall of the main floor was that we didn't feel comfortable keeping the windows open at night, so in the middle of July, the room was quite warm, although we still slept soundly. The room was very quiet with its heavy double door - we couldn't even hear the elevator adjacent to our room. This hotel is a wonderful respite after a long day of sightseeing in Paris, as it is just that bit away from the touristy areas to feel like you are escaping to your own little corner of Paris. When we return to Paris it will be to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Absolutely Charming!”
Reviews.Author: Merbear47
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean, quaint and charming. The room was nicely decorated and we had two swinging windows that opened out on to the street. There was even a fan in the closet. The bathroom was modern and bright with great shower water pressure. The shower stall was small but I am a large girl and there was a hand held shower so everything was great. I would highly recommend this hotel. There was also a large supermarket called 'Monoprix' within a 3 mintues walk. There was a pharmacy, a few boulangeries(bakeries) and many restaurants nearby. The subway line was very close as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I greatly enjoyed our stay here. It was the ideal location for us, not at all far from some great sights. We liked the hotel very much and the breakfast was delicious - the croissants were the nicest I have ever tasted. I have no doubt that we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, nice location.”
Reviews.Author: suffolk_traveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for four nights with a friend. Everything was clean, the beds were comfy, the shower cubicle was tiny, but the shower itself was great. The area around the hotel is great, fab food market on Sunday morning near the Metro station. Staff were all pleasant. Breakfast was the standard croissants etc, but filling. Only thing I would change would be to have a kettle in the room (us Brits love our cups of tea!). We took our own, and it added the 'home touch'. Overall, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good find in Paris”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After having spent many days reading through reviews of hotels in TripAdvisor (extremely useful, by the way) we decided that this hotel fitted the bill. We were not disappointed. It is a small hotel, with only 2 stars and the decor and the size of the rooms deserves the rating. However, it is in a perfect location (very close to the Tour Eiffel and sorrounded by restaurants), it is very clean, nice breakfasts and very quite (if you opt for the rooms overlooking the garden). It does not have air conditioning but each room has an electric fan which may not be sufficient during a very hot Parisian summer. The rooms are small but not cramped and the bathroom is big and full of natural light. The walls are extremely thin and if you get a rude neighbour you might be in trouble (but this goes for any hotel in Europe). We stayed for 5 nights and whilst the hotel was full every night by 12 o'clock everybody had settled down and therefore sleep was not a problem. The beds are nice and hard which is good after a long day walking in Paris. I would certainly return to this hotel (but maybe not in summer).

Reviews.Title: “Never disappointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was my forth trip and forth time at this wonderful little hotel. The front desk had my taxi waiting in the wee morning to take me to the train station. The housekeeping staff never let me down. I will not stay in any other hotel. The staff never got tired of my mouth or questions. I stay in January 2006.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and good value”
Reviews.Author: dana94591
Reviews.Content: This little gem is buried in a lovely little neighborhood which makes it nice and quiet. My husband and I loved the proximity to real Parisian life: they have a little street farmer's market during the week and we loved buying groceries for a little picnic (yes, even in cold November). Close to transportation as well as great walking. Close to Eiffel tower, Champs der Mer and Swiss Village, which houses many wonderful and fun art galleries. I enjoyed the hotel but I didn't like the smell of smoke in the corridor and the thin walls between rooms if you have discourteous neighbors. I would return there on my own or with my husband again. This is great for the money!!!

Reviews.Title: “Charm and convenience”
Reviews.Author: kpwc
Reviews.Content: Cosy hotel with provincial charm in the decor, refurbished in the last 5 years by owner Bernard Vialettes. You almost feel parisian looking out the window across to your neighbor's apartments and down onto the narrow little rue de l'avre. Conveniently round the corner from the metro (la motte-piquet grenelle), supermarket, restaurants /cafes for various budgets, boutiques and even a laundrette. 15-20 minute walk from La Tour Eiffel. In the safe middle class environment of the 15th arrondissement. Courteous and helpful staff who speak varying degrees of english. Rooms good value for money. Internet access available (but expensive and coin-operated.) Book in advance. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights and were very happy with it. We had a double garden room with bathtub and shower. The room was small but the large garden windows and high ceilings made it feel larger. The bathroom and tub were very large by other hotel standards and even had a huge window! Great water pressure. Rooms were very clean, bed was comfortable. We found the location to be excellent. We could not hear any hotel residents or guests but did hear people in surrounding apartments which wasn't too bad - that's in-city living! Breakfast was very good. Safe, convenient neighborhood. We will definately stay there again and would recommend this quaint little hotel for anyone looking for a clean, conveniently located, reasonably priced hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wikky
Reviews.Content: On the postive side: The room was lovely, spotlessly clean and very homey with obvious care taken over the decor. The bathroom was excellent, clean and large - big bathtub and great shower pressure and lots of clean fluffy towels. I had a room on the garden side but it was fourth floor so didn't actually get the benefit of the garden but I did get to hear the child next door having several tantrums, as per the previous reviewer! The hotel has a lift. On the downside: One of the reception staff (petite lady with brown hair and big smile) was wonderfully friendly and helpful but the rest were quite rude. The bed was extremely hard and uncomfortable and the walls are very thin. The location is okayish but don't expect quaint little French streets or cafes outside your door. Having said that - it's a short hop on the Metro to St Germain and all the other great sights, so apart from the noise of the church youth centre next door,you get to have peace and quiet after a hectic day of sightseeing, so it's worth the trade-off. All in all, it was a lovely place to come back to each evening to freshen up and relax. Next time I would stay in St Germain - but that is no reflection at all on this hotel. If you want a clean, quiet and peaceful room at a reasonable price ( I paid $86 euros per night), you should definitely try this.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sylvainc
Reviews.Content: We spend a week in this hotel from oct.25 to nov.01 2005. very nice hotel , we ask for a twin bed with bath and shower and view on the garden and they give us the room 12 . wow very nice decoration , very clean, lot of space in the bathroom . bed are confortable . It's a short walking distance from the metro and from the metro the hotel is very easy to find. The staff are very nice .

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: jcsc03
Reviews.Content: For our first trip abroad, my husband and I decided to give Paris a try. I found the Hotel de l’Arve through TripAdvisor and selected it based on the reviews. We had a small double room on the garden, second floor. Bathroom (with tub) was a good size. The room was fairly quiet. I think most patrons realized that the walls are thin and try to keep it down. Actually, most noise came from a child in an adjacent building who had several tantrums during our six day stay. The bed was uncomfortable for the both of us – hard with springs you could feel. The pillows had stains inside the cases. Bathroom was kept pretty clean. The towels were old and discolored but were replaced daily – whether or not we put them on the floor. I would recommend bringing something to hang from the hooks because there is no place to put your toiletries. We didn’t do breakfast at the hotel – you could buy a quiche on the main street for 2,05 euro. The Eiffel Tower was a 10 minute walk – it was lovely at night. Grocery store was nearby. Metro is right across the street. The hotel staff was always pleasant and greeted us with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Metro Convenience!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We, too, booked Hotel de l'Avre based on reviews found here on TripAdvisor. Everything listed here in the "Above Average" reviews is absolutely true. EXTREMELY convenient to the metro, clean, powerful shower, safe area, etc. What is also true is what several have commented on already.....although you can walk to the Eiffel Tower, it is not near any other "touristy" area or quaint restaurants. This was my second visit to Paris, and this hotel wins hands down between the two in areas of cleanliness, courtesy, and comfortability. We stayed on the 2nd floor facing the street (garden might be better?). If I was to go to Paris again (and I hope that I do!), I think that I would try to find another budget hotel close to Contrascarpe (awesome square) or the like. Just a personal preference.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Souze
Reviews.Content: I have spent a week at Hotel de l'Avre at the beginning of this month and i have found the hotel to be great. The rooms are very nice and clean, and Benoit the host is extremely nice. It was my second time in Paris, and i find that the location of this hotel is the best, so close to Eiffel tower, and the metro lines are extremely convenient, taking you directly to Champs-Elyses or St-germain-des-Prés. Thie only thing that bothered us was the noise, as the walls seem paper thin and we could hear noises from other rooms, and also we had a room with view on the garden, which is nice but we could also hear all the noises from the surrounding appartment buildings. Maybe a room on the street would have been better, as there is definitely not a lot of traffic on the street. I would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great find”
Reviews.Author: Tennesseans
Reviews.Content: For the money (75 euros/night) and location, this hotel is unbeatable. The staff is friendly, the rooms are clean, and the street is surprisingly quiet for being only a block from a metro stop. Don't expect large rooms for this price, but if you are only sleeping here, this is absolutely unbeatable in this price range.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for short stays”
Reviews.Author: Brkln71
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in quite a few hotels in Paris by now and the Hotel de L'avre offers good quality and prices for short stays. The rooms are very small, but for Euro 65 you can't expect the Ritz. The staff is friendly and helpful, and the hotel has a great WiFi connection. Also, the hotel is within walking distance to the Champs de Mars which leads to the Eiffel Tower, and the nearby subway Motte Picquet Grenelle, with three metro lines, offers great access to the rest of the city. The nearby Rue du Commerce offers a variety of different shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quality/price relation”
Reviews.Author: Vladaros
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in this hotel in a double with garden view room, and I can say that the room was relatively small but was extremely comfortable and clean. The bath room (specially the bathtub) was tiny but perfectly functional. The personal is very polite and always ready to assist you. The rooms (at least the ones at the back – garden view) are very quite at night. The hotel is situated at 5 minutes walk from "Champ de mars", and 10 minutes from the Eiffel tower. There is a subway station close to the hotel (1 minute walk) with direct lines to the Triumph arch and to the Notre Dame "area". The Hotel area has several coffee shops and restaurants, supermarkets and a pharmacy. The Hotel is relatively cheep considering the location, the quality of the rooms and service. This Hotel has an excellent relation quality/price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price!”
Reviews.Author: pennypup
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here in August 2005. It was our first trip to Paris, and we chose this hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews. We were not disappointed! It is a great hotel, just 2 blocks away from the Metro and very close to the Eiffel Tower. If you aren't afraid to walk, many other major sites are within walking distance, including the Louvre and the Latin Quarter. We had a street view, which was quiet enough, but we were still glad to have our earplugs. The hotel staff were pleasant and the rooms were comfortable (we had a single and a double). Yes, the rooms are small but get used to it - that's Europe and the buildings are old. If you want fancy and roomy, go stay in a Hilton. If you want a nice place to stay without breaking the bank then the Hotel de l'Avre is the place for you. As a side note, City Walks of Paris is in the neighbourhood and have excellent walking, biking, and segway tours. They are definately worth visiting. We did 3 tours with them and were really glad we did.

Reviews.Title: “This is a real gem!”
Reviews.Author: Trav11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent position, being in walking distance of the Eiffel Tower and being surrounded by shops and near a Metro station. For the price we paid (73 euros plus breakfast of 7.50 euros per person for a double room) we considered it excellent value. Our room was comfortable, clean and quite good for Parisian standards for a hotel in this price range. It was only a few doors from a supermarket, McDonalds, the Metro and a bus with a dry cleaner within 5 minutes walk and laundromats not far away either. The staff here were wonderful. Our friend had had an exceptionally bad experience in the hotel a couple of doors away so ended up at our hotel changing rooms for the 4 nights. Our hotel guy was so sympathetic with her experience that he gave her a free family room with a bath for the first night and another room for the rest of her stay at a reasonable price. Not many French hotels would do that! All the staff here were exceptionally polite and friendly which is quite unusual for a budget hotel in Paris, having stayed in Paris several times in the past where we had usually encountered rudeness. There were even English papers in the comfy reception lounge to read each day. I would certainly recommend this hotel and would go there without hesitation whenever in Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Inexpensive and Basic.”
Reviews.Author: BayAreaRes
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my son and his friend. We had 2 rooms, both were tiny, and I mean tiny. In the single room (my room), there was 1 single bed and a small desk, and that was it, and there was hardly enough room to walk around the bed. The kids' room was slightly bigger. The rooms were furnished sparsely, but clean enough. The linen was clean enough, but not attractive. The bathroom was adequate with only a shower. The proprietor was helpful but indifferent, didn't go out of the way to be helpful though. The location was great, just a short walk to the metro, and a short walk to the Seine. There is not too much to do in the area, Tour Eiffel is about a 20 minutes walk. The hotel is a small building (4 floors I think) on a small lane, next to a community center, so during the day, you can hear the kids playing. For the price, it was most adequate, but don't expect anything else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: travelbug54_10
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Hotel de L'Avre from July 11 to 18 and were very happy we did. Sure, the rooms are tiny (that's normal in Europe), but they're clean and comfortable, which is all that really mattered to us. There is no air conditioning and the weather was quite hot when we were there (32 -35 degrees Celsius), but we left the windows open most of the time and it was quite bearable. The location is wonderful - close to the Metro, tons of restaurants, a Monoprix (an inexpensive department store, but with a great selection of groceries and fresh food), and lovely shops. One of the best things about the Hotel de L'Avre is that is is not situated in a touristy area. You are in a good neighbourhood, living amongst Parisians. We enjoyed the market (under the above-ground metro track each Wednesday and Sunday) where you could buy everything from clothing to jewellery to baked goods, fresh meat and fish. As mentioned by others, the staff are very friendly and make you feel welcome. And because you have to ring the door bell to be let into the hotel, you feel very safe. We hope to return to Paris within the next few years and will definitely stay at the Hotel de L'Avre again.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Perfection”
Reviews.Author: griz
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of best I stayed in through my five week trip. The owner, Bernard, was extremly welcoming and always ready to help (even with translations!) The hotel itself was quaint and private oasis away from the hussle of Paris. I had a double room to myself, with private bathroom, desk, wardrobe, TV (with CNN) and extra blankets. Yes, it's small, but I found it inviting and extremly safe. The location is the best - only a 10-15 min walk to the Eiffel Tower. The metro is right in front (don't worry you can't hear it from your room) but I never needed to use it. Just content to walk everywhere and soak in the sights and sounds of Paris. Never had a problem with staff, who were more than happy to mind my bags before I left later than night. If I'm lucky to go back to Paris, I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Almost the best!”
Reviews.Author: Flisa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for four nights. We liked this small hotel very much. Perfect location (a few minutes walk to the metro), small but clean rooms. Liked the colours, yellow and red. We had a room on the garden, and woke up by song from birds. Not bad in a big city like Paris! We liked the friendly shoppingarea with rue Commerce, and the short way to Tour Eiffel. and all the restaurants round the corner. The only thing I didn't like was the night-staff. I can´'t beliewe that it could be difficult to look in the Yellow Pages, for example, so I did it myself.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: yatmeh
Reviews.Content: My wife and i spent 8 nights here in early May with her sister's family. The son who had studied in Paris a few years prior and, like most grad students, was perpetually broke and constantly asking mom for money gave mom this as a present (he is now employed) and invited us to come. he picked this place and it was a gem. us old folks got 2 large rooms with large bathrooms and lovely courtyard views. the location in the 14th was 200 metres from 2 subways, walking distance to the eiffel tower, rodin, napoleon's tomb and yet very nontouristy. wonderful fresh produce market nearby, a non nicolas wine shop where the proprietor "adopted" us giving impromptu tastings whenever we showed up-which was often. we liked bernaud the hotel proprietor and loved how he dissed ugly american/german tourist types-no rooms, je ne comprend pas l'anglais etc. it was hilarious. at under $100 USD per night, this is a steal. If you need fancy, large lobbies, fawning service go elsewhere and spend 3-4 times as much. we would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel, Good Location in Real Paris”
Reviews.Author: Available
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel De L'Avre in the middle of January, and would recommend it as a good choice for people on a budget. The rooms were fine, though nothing to write home about. I think I paid about 60 euros for a single room. The location is good: steps to the Metro, and in a good neighborhood that's not overrun by tourists. Lots of reasonably-priced restaurants (for Paris) nearby. The weekend market under the Metro tracks is a lot of fun, and the Tour Eiffel is about a 15 minute walk away, as is Les Invalides.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel de l'Avre in August 2004 after I read all the positive reviews here, but I wasn't awed with by this little hotel. Yes, it's charming, clean, the day managers were okay (helpful in general but a little cold), the garden was pretty... And yes, it's located in a quiet, residential neighborhood (good thing)...however, I couldn't get a good night's sleep because of the noise inside the hotel. The walls in this place are so thin I could hear TV going, people talking, people snoring, doors banging, and toilets flushing in the adjacent rooms. If you're a light sleeper like me, this is bad news.

Reviews.Title: “two thumbs up”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: just returned from Paris. What a wonderful trip. The location of this hotel is outstanding...close to the Metro stop, Eiffel tower, boulangerie (bakery) and brasserie. There's many other stores for anything you can think of around the hotel. The room was basic but well maintained as far as decor and cleanliness. Very safe. We would without a doubt stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Looking for a budget place to stay? Look no futher...”
Reviews.Author: cronstown8
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for the weekend 25-27 February as a birthday treat, and loved it. The Hotel is situated in a quiet street in a fairly classy part of the city with lots of cafes and shops nearby. The Eiffel Tower and Les Invalids are within walking distance although there is a Metro stop about 200 metres away from which you can travel cheaply (approx 2 Euros) to any part of the city. We bought a daily travel ticket for just over 8 Euros and certainly got our value from it. At no time during our stay did we feel threatened or uncomfortable walking around at night near the hotel (or anywhere else for that matter). The Hotel itself is family run and friendly. We stayed on the ground floor beside the lift but were not disturded at any time by other guests using it. The front door is locked at all times and is openned by the reception staff when you ring the bell. We found our room to be more than adequate for the job with clean bed linen and a very clean en suite facility. The towels were changed each day and the room tidied and cleaned. I will happily recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a clean, comfortable, well situated and above all inexpensive place to stay in one of the world's most beautiful cities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading the reviews on this site and am glad I did. It was right down the block from the metro and within walking distance of the Eiffel Tower, in fact we walked there everyday! Although they took longer to check us in than I would have preferred, we had to walk down the street and grab a bite while we waited, the great shower in the big bathroom made up for the wait. My husband and I really enjoyed our stay here and the breakfast was very good. I recommend this hotel, it was clean, the bathroom (we got the tub and shower room) was big and the location.

Reviews.Title: “Find other accomodations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel de l'Avre in October and found our room lacking. The bed, linens and drapes were extremely old and the room was stifling and musty. The location is good and we encountered no problems with the staff, but trust me, none of that will matter to you when you've been up all night ITCHING from the 49 year old pillows. Learn from our mistake and keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: ktinak
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at this hotel in early November 2004, with my mother and stepdaughter. The hotel is in a fantastic location, near the Tower and train stations, yet off the beaten path so you don't get all the street noise. Bernard was very pleasant and helpful, but it seemed that some of the rest of the staff couldn't be bothered. I would definitely recommend the hotel though. I have stayed at other hotels in the area that charged twice as much with half the service. I will stay at the Hotel de l'Avre on my next trip for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights from 29 Dec '04 to 2 Jan '05 at Hotel de l'Avre. It was great value for money. Room quite small but very comfortable. Staff helpful and friendly. Hotel is a very short distance to the nearest Metro. All in all an ideal hotel for a short break in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Good Quality and off the tourist track”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just got back from a 2 night stay at the Hotel L'Arve and I thought it was brilliant. In a lovely little area close to supermarkets, restuarants and cafe's and very close to the nearest Metro Picquet Grenalle. Bernard is very friendly and the room (a twin at 77E) was clean with a TV and a really nice warm high pressured shower. I would suggest this hotel to anyone without question. Personally for me - It is nice to not be staying in the hard sell, cheap and tacky touristy areas and to experience the real paris. Tres Bien!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little place”
Reviews.Author: misscoolkitty
Reviews.Content: I am surprised at all the recent negative reviews for this hotel. I have just got back from a weekend in Paris and stayed in this hotel. For the price you get a nice clean room if a little small. For 80 euros for a twin room I wouldn't have expected anything more. The area is a local area which means that there are lots of good quality resturants which aren't touristy and are always full of locals. If you want to be in the centre of the touristy left bank then this hotel isn't for you but if you want somewhere a little different then this is hotel is far more suitable.

Reviews.Title: “acceptable but not great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I agree with the recent reviews describing it as a bit shabby around the edges. I'd booked this hotel after reading many glowing reviews here, choosing between it and one located in a more chic district, and I wish I'd chosen the chicer location. While the neighborhood seems safe and residential, it's quite quiet and not close to anything much except the Eiffel Tower. We wanted to stroll through St. Germaine and had to take a rather complicated subway ride to get there (and a taxi back). The rooms were nicely decorated but a bit old and worn-looking. The bed was quite comfortable, and I did enjoy having a typically Parisian tall window that opened out on the street. The staff was pleasant enough, but I wouldn't stay here again, based on location and general blah-ness. We also had a tough time finding it in our first taxi - the taxi driver was wonderful and turned the meter off while we drove around, but it wasn't so easy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Anoini2
Reviews.Content: It's so convenient having three lines of subway half a block away and the Monoprix just around the corner. The market where they sell everything from fresh meat, produce, flower shop, shoes, clothes and fresh baked goods is just under a subway line. It made me feel like a local. They set up in the morning and tear down at night. There are days when the market is not there. The breakfast in the hotel for E7.50/pp for one croissant, french bread, juice and coffee is really good. I find it a little expensive since you can get that in the market for less the E2.00, but it's still worth it. The bread is really good. The room is clean but not the best. The mattress had a plastic liner that made it uncomfortable and sweaty to sleep in. The only problem was that you can't take food to your room which makes a big difference coz having a sit down dinner is two to three times more expensive than buying crepes or panini and just taking it to your room. I'd probably stay here next time I'll visit Paris. The location and price makes up for the incoveniences.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our room was on the top floor facing the street. The street was very quiet and the room was very clean with a comfortably sized bathroom. Staff were very friendly and the location was great. I'd totally recommend this hotel, especially considering the bargain price!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean with excellent value for location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After a lot of research, it was here on Trip Advisor where we decide to try this hotel. Now returning from our trip, I wanted to share our positive experience. We were only in Paris for one night last week, and the hotel was just as everyone described, accomodating, very clean (hard to find in 2 & 3 star Paris hotels), not to mention storing our luggage until our room was ready (we arrived very early since we were there one day). We opted for the deluxe double with the garden view and it was very quiet. Just keep in mind, these are still typical small Paris hotel sized rooms with very firm beds. But that is what we wanted since we were only there for the night and really did not unpack our suitcases. Location: It was out of the main stream, tho in the 15e, it just bordered the southern part of 7e and gave us "next door" access to the Eiffel & Louvre. Anytime we needed a taxi, the staff was most willing to call us one. Our only hesitancy about this hotel was the quiet you got from it's obscurity became a liability because we did not find a single taxi drive that knew where this hotel or street was. I luckily always carry maps with me so I pulled one out to show our driver when we arrived. After checking in, it was easy to hand them the hotel card which had a map on the back (front desk have these sitting out). Later we thought of an easier solution, to tell them to simply take us to the bus station or McDonalds, a short 1/2 block around the corner. Finally, because this was our first visit, and all the staff spoke English, it was an easier visit than most first time Americans I know who don't have a handle on their French yet (we are among that bunch). After much review of the 2 & 3 star French hotels in this area prior to our visit, I reaffirm you simply can't beat the value, location & uncommon friendliness of the staff.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel de l'Avre
HotelInfo.Address: 21, rue de l'Avre | 15 Arr., 75015 Paris, France
